solution_line_template: The baseball glove was originally ${glove_original_price} and he agreed to take 20% off so {glove_original_price}*{discount_percent_decimal} = $<<{glove_original_price}*{discount_percent_decimal}={glove_discount_amount}>>{glove_discount_amount} off

If you take the price of the glove and subtract the discount then ${glove_original_price}-${glove_discount_amount} = $<<{glove_original_price}-{glove_discount_amount}={glove_final_price}>>{glove_final_price}

He sold {num_cleats_pairs} pair of shoes for ${price_per_cleat_pair} each so {num_cleats_pairs}*${price_per_cleat_pair} = $<<{num_cleats_pairs}*{price_per_cleat_pair}={cleats_total_price}>>{cleats_total_price}

He got ${cards_price} for the cards, ${bat_price} for the bat, ${glove_final_price} for the glove and ${cleats_total_price} for the shoes so he made ${cards_price}+${bat_price}+${glove_final_price}+${cleats_total_price} = $<<{cards_price}+{bat_price}+{glove_final_price}+{cleats_total_price}={total_money_made}>>{total_money_made}
